I was pulling an asteroid with 4 Nerv and it immediately explode due to overheating, is it normal? ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

![8353B5C1053E5729693AC62CB5DD34F5A6828C32](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/37496212290893500/8353B5C1053E5729693AC62CB5DD34F5A6828C32/)
LOL! That's hilarious! I guess that's what happens when meteors burn up in our atmosphere, but you really cooked it!
Potatoroids have a heat tolerance of 2500, which is way higher than the melting point of ore, right, devs?
It exploded half a second after I pushed the Z button. ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

> 
> It exploded half a second after I pushed the Z button. ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

Nervas, by dint of being a nuclear freaking reactor blasting its coolant into space as propulsion, generate a fair amount of heat. My best guess is that some weirdness happened in how the heat transferred around your craft and ended up using the rock as a heatsink.
